organic_results.title: Sam Altman - Wikipedia
organic_results.snippet: Samuel H. Altman (born April 22, 1985) is an American entrepreneur, investor, and programmer. He is the CEO of OpenAI, a research laboratory that aims to promote and develop friendly artificial intelligence in a way that benefits humanity as a whole. Previously, he was president of Y Combinator from 2014 to 2019.

organic_results.title: Sam Altman (@sama) | Twitter
organic_results.snippet: CEO of @OpenAI. Previously president of @YCombinator, co-founder of @Loopt. Building towards AGI. Stanford dropout. Investor in companies like Airbnb, Reddit, and Stripe.

organic_results.title: Sam Altman | LinkedIn
organic_results.snippet: CEO at OpenAI. Former President of Y Combinator. Co-founder of Loopt. Stanford University dropout. Early investor in companies like Airbnb, Reddit, and Stripe.

organic_results.title: Sam Altman's Journey: From Y Combinator to OpenAI CEO
organic_results.snippet: A detailed profile of Sam Altman's career trajectory, from his early days at Y Combinator to leading OpenAI. The article covers his vision for AI development and his role in shaping the future of technology.

organic_results.title: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman on AI Safety and Future of Technology
organic_results.snippet: In an exclusive interview, Sam Altman discusses OpenAI's approach to AI safety, the challenges of developing advanced AI systems, and his vision for the future of technology.

organic_results.snippet: Comprehensive overview of Sam Altman's investments and venture capital activities, including his early investments in companies like Airbnb, Reddit, and Stripe, as well as his current focus on AI startups.
